newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Subic gains time to re-evaluate port bids.
newsitem.headline: Subic gains time to re-evaluate port bids.

text.p: The Subic Bay Metropolitan Administration (SBMA) has been given more time to review bids for a multi-million-peso contract to run a port in the freeport area, Philippine President Fidel Ramos said on Wednesday.
"SBMA has asked us for a few days extension so that they can continue their re-evaluaton of the bids... We have granted them that extension," Ramos said in a televised news conference.
SBMA last month awarded the contract to the second highest bidder, the Philippine unit of Hong Kong's Hutchison Whampoa Ltd.

It said the highest bidder, International Container Terminal Services Inc (ICTSI), violated a ban by the Department of Transportation and Communications on port operators holding more than 20 percent interest in more than one international port in the country.
ICTSI countered that the SBMA is an autonomous agency and is not under that department.
President Ramos had asked the SBMA to review its decision and re-evaluate all of the submitted bids. The agency was supposed to have given its decision on September 19.
